body_content.explanation: an electronic system for following someone or something that is moving or being transported in order to find out where they are at a particular time:
examples: The company is pouring millions into a track and trace service so that internet companies can keep their customers up to date on the progress of their deliveries.

body_content.explanation: an electronic system for seeing how a disease is spreading and who is affected by it, and then finding other people who might have been infected:
examples: Test, track and trace – TTT – involves testing people for coronavirus, tracking the spread of the virus, then tracing the people an infected person has come into contact with.
The Government hopes to roll out the test, track, and trace app across the whole of the United Kingdom by the middle of May.
Coronavirus: Councils across the north of England are to set up their own track-and-trace systems.

body_content.explanation: to follow, using electronic equipment, someone or something that is moving or being transported in order to find out where they are at a particular time:
examples: We'll give you a password and you can track and trace loads via the Internet.

body_content.explanation: to discover, using electronic equipment, how a disease is spreading and who is affected by it, and then find other people who might have been infected:
examples: The aim of such apps is to allow those who have been in close contact with anyone confirmed to have COVID-19 to be tracked and traced.
